Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges, and Elections

Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the designation by the Council of Josephine Bolus, RN, CNP, APRN-BC as a member of the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation Board of Directors.

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections respectfully reports:

Pursuant to the Unconsolidated Laws of the State of New York, 7384., paragraph 1, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the designation by the Council of Josephine Bolus, RN, CNP, APRN-BC as a member of the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation Board of Directors to serve for a term expiring on March 20, 2008.

This matter was referred to the Committee on December 15, 2003.

Res. No. _____

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE DESIGNATION BY THE COUNCIL OF  JOSPEHINE BOLUS, RN, CNP, APRN-BC AS A MEMBER OF THE NEW YORK CITY HEALTH AND HOSPITALS CORPORATION BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to Unconsolidated Laws of the State of New York, 7384., paragraph 1, the Council does hereby approve the designation by the Council of Josephine Bolus, RN, CNP, APRN-BC as a member of the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation Board of Directors for a term expiring on March 20, 2008.
Items.MatterName: M 834 - Josephine Bolus, Health and Hospitals Corporation Board of Directors

Items.Title:
Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the appointment by the Mayor of Hugh James Freund, Esq. as a member of the New York City Art Commission.

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections respectfully reports:

Pursuant to sections 31 and 851 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the appointment by the Mayor of Hugh James Freund, Esq. as a member of the New York City Art Commission to serve for a term expiring on December 31, 2005.

This matter was referred to the Committee on December 3, 2003.

Res. No. _______

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE APPOINTMENT BY THE MAYOR OF HUGH JAMES FREUND, ESQ. AS A MEMBER OF THE NEW YORK CITY ART COMMISSION

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to sections 31 and 851 of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the appointment by the Mayor of Hugh James Freund, Esq. as a member of the New York City Art Commission for a term expiring on December 31, 2005.
Items.MatterName: M 778 - Hugh J. Freund, New York City Art Commission

Items.Title:
Resolution approving with modification the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 030490 ZSM (L.U. No. 584), the grant of a special permit pursuant to Section 74-712 of the Zoning Resolution to modify the use regulations for a proposed development to allow Use Group 2 and 6 uses at 465 Broadway a.k.a. 106-112 Grand Street (Block 474/Lots 38, 49 and 1101-1102), Manhattan, in the SoHo Cast Iron District, within an M1-5B District.
 ..Body

By Council Members Katz and Avella


     	WHEREAS, the City Planning Commission filed with the Council on November 7, 2003 its decision dated November 5, 2003 (the "Decision") on the application submitted by WXIV/Broadway Grand Realty, L.L.C., pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter, Community District 2, Borough of Manhattan (ULURP No.  C 030490 ZSM) (the "Application");

    	WHEREAS, the Application is related to Application Number N 030489 ZRM (L.U. No 583), an amendment to the text of the Zoning Resolution;

     	WHEREAS, the City Planning Commission has made the findings required pursuant to Section 74-712 of the Zoning Resolution;

WHEREAS, the Decision is subject to review and action by the Council pursuant to Section 197-d(b)(1) of the City Charter;

      	WHEREAS, upon due notice, the Council held a public hearing on December 1, 2003 on the Decision and Application;

      	WHEREAS, the Council has considered the relevant environmental issues and the Negative Declaration, issued on June 2, 2003 (CEQR No. 03DCP042M); and

      	WHEREAS, the Council has considered the land use implications and other policy issues relating to the Decision and Application;
     	       	       	       	       	       	       		
RESOLVED:

     	The Council finds that the action described herein will have no significant effect on the environment; and

      	Pursuant to Sections 197-d and 200 of the New York City Charter and on the basis of the Decision and Application, the Council approves the Decision with the following modification:

Matter in double-underline is new, to be added by the Council.
Matter in [  ] is old, to be deleted by the Council.

The application submitted by WXIV/Broadway Grand Realty, L.L.C for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Section 74-712 of the Zoning Resolution to modify the use regulations for a proposed development on a zoning lot where not more than twenty percent of the lot area is occupied by existing buildings to allow retail use (Use Group 6 uses) and/or residential use (Use Group 2 uses) on the ground floor and cellar and to allow residential use (Use Group 2 uses) on the 2nd through 14th floors of a proposed 14-story building on property located at 465 Broadway a.k.a. 106-112 Grand Street (Block 474/Lot[s] 38[, 49 and 1101-1102]), in the SoHo Cast Iron Historic District, within an M1-5B District.

Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the designation by the Council of Josephine Bolus, RN, CNP, APRN-BC as a member of the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation Board of Directors.

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections respectfully reports:

Pursuant to the Unconsolidated Laws of the State of New York, 7384., paragraph 1, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the designation by the Council of Josephine Bolus, RN, CNP, APRN-BC as a member of the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation Board of Directors to serve for a term expiring on March 20, 2008.

This matter was referred to the Committee on December 15, 2003.

Res. No. _____

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE DESIGNATION BY THE COUNCIL OF  JOSPEHINE BOLUS, RN, CNP, APRN-BC AS A MEMBER OF THE NEW YORK CITY HEALTH AND HOSPITALS CORPORATION BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to Unconsolidated Laws of the State of New York, 7384., paragraph 1, the Council does hereby approve the designation by the Council of Josephine Bolus, RN, CNP, APRN-BC as a member of the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation Board of Directors for a term expiring on March 20, 2008.
Items.MatterName: M 834 - Josephine Bolus, Health and Hospitals Corporation Board of Directors

Resolution approving with modification the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 030490 ZSM (L.U. No. 584), the grant of a special permit pursuant to Section 74-712 of the Zoning Resolution to modify the use regulations for a proposed development to allow Use Group 2 and 6 uses at 465 Broadway a.k.a. 106-112 Grand Street (Block 474/Lots 38, 49 and 1101-1102), Manhattan, in the SoHo Cast Iron District, within an M1-5B District.
 ..Body

By Council Members Katz and Avella


     	WHEREAS, the City Planning Commission filed with the Council on November 7, 2003 its decision dated November 5, 2003 (the "Decision") on the application submitted by WXIV/Broadway Grand Realty, L.L.C., pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter, Community District 2, Borough of Manhattan (ULURP No.  C 030490 ZSM) (the "Application");

    	WHEREAS, the Application is related to Application Number N 030489 ZRM (L.U. No 583), an amendment to the text of the Zoning Resolution;

     	WHEREAS, the City Planning Commission has made the findings required pursuant to Section 74-712 of the Zoning Resolution;

WHEREAS, the Decision is subject to review and action by the Council pursuant to Section 197-d(b)(1) of the City Charter;

      	WHEREAS, upon due notice, the Council held a public hearing on December 1, 2003 on the Decision and Application;

      	WHEREAS, the Council has considered the relevant environmental issues and the Negative Declaration, issued on June 2, 2003 (CEQR No. 03DCP042M); and

      	WHEREAS, the Council has considered the land use implications and other policy issues relating to the Decision and Application;
     	       	       	       	       	       	       		
RESOLVED:

     	The Council finds that the action described herein will have no significant effect on the environment; and

      	Pursuant to Sections 197-d and 200 of the New York City Charter and on the basis of the Decision and Application, the Council approves the Decision with the following modification:

Matter in double-underline is new, to be added by the Council.
Matter in [  ] is old, to be deleted by the Council.

The application submitted by WXIV/Broadway Grand Realty, L.L.C for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Section 74-712 of the Zoning Resolution to modify the use regulations for a proposed development on a zoning lot where not more than twenty percent of the lot area is occupied by existing buildings to allow retail use (Use Group 6 uses) and/or residential use (Use Group 2 uses) on the ground floor and cellar and to allow residential use (Use Group 2 uses) on the 2nd through 14th floors of a proposed 14-story building on property located at 465 Broadway a.k.a. 106-112 Grand Street (Block 474/Lot[s] 38[, 49 and 1101-1102]), in the SoHo Cast Iron Historic District, within an M1-5B District.
